intro: Spiesia sulphurea, commonly known as the sulphur flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that are highly visible and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Spiesia sulphurea typically grows in coastal areas and thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. Its unique color and structure make it a notable ornamental plant in horticulture.
